label.INDPERSSAFE: Percentage of people feeling very unsafe walking alone in their area after dark

result.label: Indicator - Personal safety
note:
[b]Personal safety[/b]

[b]How do we measure this?[/b]
Percentage of people feeling very unsafe walking alone in their area after dark

[b]Source[/b]
Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey
[url=https://www.justice-ni.gov.uk/publications/r-s-bulletin-findings-202223-northern-ireland-safe-community-telephone-survey]R & S Bulletin Findings from the 2022/23 Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey | Department of Justice (justice-ni.gov.uk)[/url]

[b]Impact of Covid-19[/b]
There was a change in survey mode from 2020/21 due to the pandemic and the method by which interviews were undertaken changed from face-to-face to telephone. This resulted in a break in the time series. The change reduced the sample size, particularly for 2020/21. Results for the three latest years are not directly comparable with previous sweeps.[b]

Further Information[/b]
1. The Northern Ireland Safe Community Survey was previously known as the NI Crime Survey. Given the change in survey mode as a result of the pandemic, the survey years from 2020/21 are referenced as the Northern Ireland Safe Community Telephone Survey.
2. Previously conducted on an ad hoc basis, the survey began operating on a continuous basis in January 2005.
3. Results exclude don't knows and refusals.
